How artificial sweeteners secretly age your brain and memory
description: New research suggests artificial sweeteners, commonly found in diet drinks and sugar-free products, may impact brain health. Studies indicate a link between higher intake and reduced cognitive performance, resembling accelerated brain aging. Scientists are exploring how these sweeteners interact with gut bacteria, inflammation, and neural pathways, urging caution despite regulatory approval for other health aspects.

Selected professors will guide teachers in pedagogy, digital literacy, foundational learning and other key areas through the NMM portal.

title: Apple's warning to stores: Foreign SIM = penalty; outlets face closure risk
description: Apple distributors are warning Indian retailers against activating new iPhones, especially the iPhone 17 series, with foreign SIMs within 90 days, citing hefty penalties and store code blocking. This crackdown follows a surge in iPhone 17 models being diverted to high-margin markets like Russia, Africa, and the Middle East, causing domestic shortages. Retailers are pushing back against this mandate, arguing it unfairly targets them.

title: India–Canada trade talks: Piyush Goyal says negotiations to restart
description: India and Canada are set to resume negotiations on a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, aiming to boost bilateral trade to $50 billion by 2030. This move signals renewed trust and investor confidence, following a period of strained relations. The agreement will explore collaboration in critical minerals, technology, and energy sectors.

The company assured that the incident has no impact on its business operations or future deliveries, while its shares experienced a significant drop before partially recovering.

title: Dharmendra no more: Hindi cinema loses a legend; nation remembers his golden era
description: Veteran actor Dharmendra, Bollywood's 'He-Man', passed away in Mumbai at 89 after a brief illness. Renowned for a prolific career spanning six decades and over 300 films, including the iconic 'Sholay', the legendary actor leaves an indelible mark on Indian cinema. His final film, 'Ikkis', is slated for release next year. Dharmendra's legacy is celebrated for his versatility and charm.

'Claimed he had a heart attack': Woman used dupatta to strangle husband; lover on run
description: Vadodara police arrested a 25-year-old woman for allegedly murdering her husband, claiming he died of a heart attack. Her suspicious behavior led to an investigation, revealing a conspiracy with her lover and an accomplice who used her dupatta to strangle the victim. The trio had been planning the murder for three months.

title: Areas close to waste-to-energy plants have Delhi’s worst air; Okhla, Ghazipur worst hit
description: Residents near Delhi's waste-to-energy plants endure severe pollution, with foul air and acrid odors plaguing their neighborhoods year-round. Despite burning thousands of tons of waste daily and emitting toxic pollutants, these plants are excluded from emergency pollution control measures like GRAP, leaving communities vulnerable to chronic and seasonal health impacts.

title: Living in a parasocial world: When your new 'best friend' is a popular stranger
description: In 2025, 'parasocial' became the word of the year, reflecting a world where emotional bonds with public figures feel like friendships.  From influencers to athletes, this one-sided connection offers comfort and community, blurring lines between fantasy and reality.  This phenomenon, amplified by social media, shapes our modern human experience, bringing both joy and potential pitfalls.

title: How new labour laws could hit your take-home salary; impact on PF & gratuity decoded
description: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

title: OpenAI's internal memo: Altman notes Google’s AI success; calls it 'temporary headwind'
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.
